info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 11:48AM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida...
St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County.
.The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney near Geneva is forecast to steadily rise to Minor Flood Stage by midday on Tuesday due to heavy rainfall that fell across the basin this weekend. Once reaching Minor Flood, the river at Geneva is forecast to crest around 8.3 feet by this weekend.
For the St. Johns River...including Above Lake Harney...Minor flooding is forecast.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EDT.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...St Johns River near Above Lake Harney.
* WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 8.3 feet, Docks are partially submerged along the river between Lake Harney and Lemon Bluff.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to 8.3 feet Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
